headline: Zucchini Pickles
description: Pickled zucchini are perfect for sandwiches and snacking! This easy recipe for sweet and tangy zucchini pickles makes great use of a bumper zucchini crop.
name: Zucchini Pickles
recipeIngredient: 0.5 pound onions, quartered and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Combine zucchini and onions in a large bowl; cover with water and stir in salt until dissolved. Let vegetables soak for at least 2 hours, then drain and transfer to a large pot.
Bring sugar, vinegar, mustard seeds, celery seed, turmeric, and yellow mustard to a boil in a saucepan. Pour mixture over zucchini and onions and let stand for at least 2 more hours.
Place the pot with vegetables, spices, and pickling liquid on the stove and bring to a boil. Boil for 3 minutes.

Meanwhile, inspect three 1-quart jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones. Immerse in simmering water for at least 5 minutes or until vegetables are ready. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water.

Pack vegetables into the hot, sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top with pickling liquid. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue. Top with lids and screw on rings.

Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 10 minutes.

Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 24 hours. Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area.

review.reviewBody: I and the friends I gave this to loved it. Friends came back for more or asked for the recipe.
Easy to follow instructions, other than the size of the jars, and it comes together fairly quickly as well. I decided to try spears, so fingers crossed they still have a pleasing texture!
Love the taste of the zucchini and was easy to do Love it ken
Never made these before so hopefully they will turn out ok

I didn’t have celery seed and used less sugar, making it to my own taste and flavour profile. The best way I could describe this is that the pickles taste like the sauce from a McDonald’s cheeseburger. It is delish!!!! TRY IT!

These are delicious. I only had a little bit of apple cider vinegar so I used mostly white vinegar. We are eating them so quickly and I save the leftover liquid to use for mixing into various salad dressings including potato salads.
Really good zickles! My family loves them. It did not make as much as the recipe said and be careful with the turmeric, it stains. Thanks for the recipe!
Great recipe! I peeled and sliced my zucchini. So good on brats and sandwiches. This a keeper. Thanks for sharing.

As some others noted, this does not fill 3 qt jars but rather 3 pint jars. I didn't think the liquid looked like quite enough so I added another 1/2 c each of sugar and vinegar. So it made more than I needed. I'll just put the balance in fridge to keep for relish or something. I'm sure they will taste great as the liquid was very yummy. Also be sure to adjust processing time according to your altitude.

First made them June 5, 2020. I used a little more than 2 lbs of zucchini. I used only 1 cup of sugar. The recipe made 3 PINTS, rather than the 3 QUARTS the recipe says. I haven't tasted them yet. 

**Tasted them August 28, 2020. They are delicious! I am super glad I only used half the sugar. They would've been ridiculously sweet otherwise. A great option for excess zucchinis!

I got TWO 8oz and ONE Pint, plus half cup over. NOT THREE QUARTS. Recommend to wait until ready to cook before sterilizing jars. Mine got cold this way. Had to reheat them. (better to leave in the canner with rack up. Haven't tasted them yet. Possible measurements are different from pounds to cups.
Absolutely our families favorite
All was tasty but the zucchini amount was deff off ..
Delicious. The recipe only made 3 pint jars. Have to double or triple it next time. May as well make a big batch instead of dirtying all the pots and dishes 3 times!
We enjoy all therecipes from Allrecipes. This recipe is delicious and easy; but although I followed the measurements and directions closely, I still only yielded 2 quarts and a pint.
Very much a hamburger pickle (mustardy) as opposed to a snacking style pickle, but it’s good on a burger.
Do not underestimate the deliciousness of a pickled zucchini

I left out the onions (to my family's disgust), added fresh fennel and also reduced the sugar considerably. 
After this, used the same recipe to pickle quail eggs and they were sublime. Have already processed 15kg of zucchini this season and my family devours the pickles as fast as I produce them.
Sure wish my zucchini plants made it this year. We loved these pickles and received so many raves on them but I had no supply to make.

Congratulations and thanks for this great recipe. When I tasted it before cooking I thought it needed something more. I ground in some fennel seeds. Perfect! Everyone loves it. Made 2 batches In the past month and making more this week for gifts. I sliced the zucchini thinly.

Lovely recipe, everyone love it, I did my zucchini in very thin ribbons which is nice, next time I will cut down the onion, thought it was a bit much, used celery leaves minced (2 tablespoons) since nowhere in my shops here, still came out great! Even the husband liked it and he's the fussiest with things like this. Highly recommend this recipe.

Just opened our first jar of these. A delicious bread and butter style pickle. Maybe not quite as crunchy as a cucumber pickle, but very good. I used Walla Walla sweet onions in these, and the only pieces are to die for! Husband said they were as good or better than the store-bought bread and butter slices I'd been using. Will do again.

I agree with other reviewers that these did not make as many jars as indicated. I doubled the recipe and got 6 pints of pickles.
So easy to make and delicious ! these are great on a grilled chicken sandwich . you must try them. I used the yellow zucchini - a sweeter flavor. will def. make again !!
I also added fresh dill, dill seed, garlic, and black peppercorns.
Really good, makes great gifts as well! I ran out of turmeric, used mild curry powder instead. Turned out fine. ??

I used 3 lbs and doubled the brine and got 6 pint jars exactly full! Such an amazing flavor.
I let them sit in the hot liquid for 4 hours, I went out, and they were epic! 
Girl child already claimed one of the six for herself

2.5# of food processor sliced zucchini (so paper thin-oops) plus 1/2# of onions made for 4 pints of pickles. The last pint had more liquid than pickles but it still filled it to the top for headspace. I'm letting them marinate before opening a jar but the sample pieces I stole were tasty.
These pickles were tough and incredibly sweet, beyond what I would expect bread and butter pickles should be.
Very good tasting pickles. Wish I had not waited until the season was almost over. Should have made more and more!

We had a plethora (A PLETHORA, I SAY) of zucchini from one plant in our garden so I made these. I followed the recipe exactly, though I didn't have any mustard seed. These pickles are GREAT! Keep in mind these are kind of a sweet pickle. I think next time I might put more onion in because they were as good as the zucchini. And maybe a little more pickling liquid, as I ran a bit short. Reluctantly gave two jars away to relatives. Highly recommended!
I will probably put in more zucchini. I put it into pint jars thinking it would make six jars but it only made four. Can't wait to try them. I also added red pepper flakes and a cayenne pepper.
Did not change a thing . They were perfect and wonderful and very tasty

My family and I love these pickles! I halved the sugar and added jalapeño slices to each jar. I made them in 2mm and 4mm slices, because some of us like them thin to pile on a sandwich and some of us like them thicker to snack on. Lovely!

I made this in a very small batch just to see how it would turn out since I've never pickled zucchini. I did add some garlic cloves (whole), dill and a pickling spice mix. Just did them last night but will see what they taste like. Pretty easy to follow just mostly waiting around for the veggies to soak. I used a mandolin to make very thin slices.
This was delicious! Yield wasn’t as much as the recipe indicTed but taste was right on.
Great Pickles

We've made and canned these for several years now. We have a large garden in upstate NY and when the Zucchini comes in, it comes in bushels! The process of canning is pretty easy...but a lost art. We give jars of these sweet and zesty treats to our friends as a gift. They're great as an appetizer with a drink before dinner. Our late friend who passed a few years ago at the age of 87 would take a fork and eat an entire jar while chatting and having martinis with us!
Measured all ingredients exactly. Made only 2 quarts, less than stated in the recipe.

These turned out really well! The only change I made was adding a little pickle crisp to the jar, and they WERE crispy. I made both rounds and spears, and the rounds held their crisp better. I am making more today, and I will probably cut the sugar down, as they were a bit too sweet for my hubby.
When I first told my family that these pickles were made with zucchini instead of cukes, they were a little sceptical but, one taste and they were hooked!!! Love this recipe!!
When I first told my family that these pickles were made with zucchini instead of cukes, they were a little sceptical but, one taste and they were hooked!!! Love this recipe!!
I made it exactly as directed and they were great. Of course it is only 3 pints. Using 2 pounds of zucchini how could you be surprised it was not 3 quarts.
Had an over abundance of zucchini and this saved the day! Just as good if not better than made with cucumbers! Only thing it does make less than what it quotes but delicious!

Excellent recipe! These are so good and provide a tasty solution for using up that zucchini that never seems to stop coming! If I don't have quite enough poundage of zucchini, I combine it with sliced cucumbers. Basically you need 1-1/2 cups of vinegar and 1 cup sugar with each pound of zucchini, so I try to do batches of 3# of zucchini to make the canning process more worth the work. I like to use part white vinegar and part ACV, but I should warn you that the hot ACV will stain your counter, so be sure and protect your counter, unless you don't mind doing some heavy scrubbing with baking soda.
All I can say is love, love. Love!
started tasting liquid at 1 c. sugar and stopped there. We don't like a sweet, sweet pickle. Haven't opened jar yet. Waiting till fall / winter. Can't wait to eat with pintos or beef stew.

I was very happy that the zucchini remained crisp. I added peppercorns to the list of spices and everything turned out much better than I had expected. I've not been a fan of zucchini pickles in the past, but this recipe is a keeper for the seemingly never ending supply of zucchini my garden keeps producing.

SO GOOD!!! These come out crunchy and fabulous! I get asked to bring these to family functions all the time. It is a great way to use up all of that zucchini. I try to pick the zucchini while it is still quite small since the texture is better. ENJOY!!!
Easy and delicious! I added squash and zucchini. A bit sweet but very yummy, my 8 year old loves them too!

The only change we made was to let the zucchini, onions and salt set over-night. Other than that we followed the recipe. These are great right out of the jar! Next batch I'm going to drop a few hot peppers in the mix.....I've made 4 batches so far. The first was a test to see if we like them and the last 3 I did 10 lbs. of zucchini each that made 6 quarts. (That's how much we loved them) I didn't quite 5x the recipe for that much, but just adjust to your taste.
Kick recipe! Instead of using just zucchini I used squash. Definitely a keeper!!!!

This exactly how I make my bread and butter pickles (no prepared mustard though) with cucumbers. I can't wait to try this recipe with zucchini. For some reason it's hard to get nice pickling cucumbers where I live, but zucchini is no problem. Thanks for inspiring me to try something a little bit different. I know already that I will love them.
Great pickles. Can't even tell they're zucchini. Waaaay too sweet for me though. Great on burgers though.
I loved this! No one can tell it's zucchini !
This is delicious! Such a treat. It does take a good long time with all the waiting but I find filling that time with making jams and cucumber pickles a great way to fill a day of canning
Taste great, assuming you like sweet pickles. Indistinguishable from cucumber pickles.
Very yummy. Had a whole jar left over of liquid though (I tripled the recipe). Kind of bread and buttery flavor, but better!

The pickles were good. My husband loves all sweet pickles, so it was win win BUT I only got 3 pints NOT 3 Qts. I even weighed everything since it was my first time making them. The other thing that was confusing was it said 1:35 min to prepare, how can that be when you soak for two hours, then add the boiling syrup and soak again for two hours. A lot of time for three pints of pickles. If I had known I would have doubled the recipe. The taste is very good.

Exceptional recipe! Thank you so much for this. I used your spices and I used pickling spices and both turned out with a wonderful flavor. I do suggest if anyone uses pickling spices to add the prepared mustard. You nailed it with regards to flavor but my two pounds of zucchini did only yield 3 pints using all the liquids.
These are outstanding pickles! I cut mine into spears as well as thin slices, and liked the spears better. Also added some sliced jalapenos to the recipe.
So awesome, easy recipe, outstanding results, perfect way for excess. Thank you for sharing.

The pickles were delicious!

I had some leftover pickling liquid, and I couldn't bear to throw it out (about 3 cups worth). So what I did was make some great BBQ sauce by adding a jar of tomato sauce, then boiled it down until it was reduced by half. I added a little bit of cornstarch as well just to thicken it up even more. I poured it over some chicken to bake, then poured the pan drippings over rice. It was delicious and everyone in my family loved it.
Delicious taste like grandmothers.
These were a hit. I made 2 batches and will can a couple more batches tomorrow. They taste just like bread and butter pickles!

Great recipe. Fantastic taste and relatively easy to make. I wish the slices were crisper, but they were good. The only other issue is that this will not make 3 quarts or pickles, more like 1 1/2 or 2 at best. The brine was the perfect amount for 2 quarts. I don't have canning equipment, so I stopped after step 3. I then let jars rest until sealed, then will refrigerate until they are eaten. I think if I wanted crisper slices, I could dump the hot liquid on the slices in the jars, then seal.
THESE ARE AWESOME!!! I've made 4 batches so far this summer(12 pint size jars)and they are so easy to make!! Great recipe!!!

Warning the recipe states 2 lbs zucchini yields 3 qts I think they meant 3 pints. I did 10 lbs zucchini (5times all ingredients) and instead of getting 15 qts I got 7 plus 1 pint. Half what the recipe stated. Other then that I made these today and they were pretty straight forward. I have not done much canning before and for a first time solo these were a good start. I tasted some prior canning and was very pleased. Fewer jars then expected was both good and bad, good because it means I can make another batch if I want without having more then I could ever use. 10 lbs of zucchini was only 1week of harvest. Bad because I had taken time to prep slot more jars then needed. 3 stars because of that.
This recipe was in my new magazine and had to try it. WOW...Great...everyone wanted a jar so i had to make another batch. Will definately be making these over and over again.

Never pickled anything before...had some zucchini coming off and started hunting for recipes. This one came up and we gave it a try. Oh my goodness......absolutely wonderful!! We saved the liquid after the pickles were gone and marinated chicken in it then cooked chicken, tators, onions, mushrooms, carrots, peas, corn, zucchini, and pineapple like a roast in it....no words can describe how amazing all the flavors meshed. It was an excellent meal that had everyone going back for seconds.

This recipe is excellent. Everyone that tried them thought they were made with cucumbers. The recipe did not fill 3 quart jars for me. I made them a second time with more vegetables and a little more of the ingredients for the brine and did get 3 quarts. Delicious!!
Very good and easy recipe! Taste almost like my grandmother's bread and butter pickles. My father in law hates cucumbers so this is a great alternative, I will be making lots of these.
Outstanding.Used my french fry cutter to make spears( blunt spears ) rather than rounds. Will do this again.
Easy to make and taste is exceptional!

These pickles are delicious! I just love them! I did some in chunks and some in thin slices, the pickling liquid is almost good enough to drink by itself :) The only issue I had was coming out short on veggies, so I would measure to make sure you have enough.
What a brilliant recipe! No one guesses that these are zucchini instead of cucumber and I get to use all my bumper crop of zucchini in a way fun and unique way.
